title: mum who looked up i
story: Mum who looked up I want to give up my child guilty of causing baby daughters deathNafahat,  months, died of a chest infection after weeks of neglect at the hands of -year-old Fartun Jamal at her flat in Kingfisher Way, Brent Park, LondonFartun Jamal made a series of web searches, including I cant cope with my child anymore and I want to give up my child prior to the girls death Image: Met PoliceByNina LloydNews reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA mother who caused her baby daughteraposs death after searching I want to give up my child online while keeping her in a chaotic and dirty home is facing jail. Nafahat,  months, died of a chest infection after weeks of neglect at the hands of -year-old Fartun Jamal at her flat in Kingfisher Way, Brent Park, London. The mother made a series of web searches, including I canapost cope with my child anymore and I want to give up my child, while living with the baby in early . She knew Nafahat was unwell with a very high temperature and poor appetite but failed to take her to a doctor, jurors were told during a trial at Harrow Crown Court. Visitors in the weeks leading up to the babyaposs death recalled her cot was broken and the flat was overrun with takeaway boxes, dirty plates and nappies.  On February , social services attended the property after concerns were raised by a babysitter. However, they warned Jamal ahead of their visit and, when they arrived, they found the flat was clean and the situation had improved. A second social services visit, without warning, was planned for March  - the day Nafahat died. When paramedics were called to the property by a neighbour at .pm, Jamal told them she had found her daughteraposs body after having a dream the baby had stopped breathing. During the three-week trial, jurors were told the baby had been ill from at least March  and could have been saved had her mother sought adequate medical care. Jamal claimed a GP had told her Nafahat look fine andit gets worse, give her some Calpol when she raised concerns about her daughteraposs health in the weeks before her death. But prosecutor Edward Brown QC told jurors the mother had never spoken with a doctor. Instead, Jamal had called the nearest surgery twice but never got through to a GP, with receptionists adamant they would not have offered her medical advice, the court was told. Jamal had an abusive upbringing and moved to the UK from Somalia at a young age without her mother, jurors heard. Giving evidence, she said when Nafahat was born she instantly fell in love with her the moment I got hold of her. But she told jurors she became depressed and anxious due to being a parent with little support. I felt useless because of the le I had growing up. I didnapost want the same , she said. Nicolly Ruffo, a babysitter who attended the home on March , said the property smelt of old milk, with the cupboards empty of food apart from crisps. Another babysitter, Aimee Whittaker-George, contacted social services about the living conditions after visiting the home on February . A witness statement from Dr Michael Coren, a consultant paediatrician, said: There was clear evidence of neglect in the family home of Ms Jamal. He said there were environmental signs of neglect and the flat was chaotic and dirty. Jamal was charged with one count of causing Nafahataposs death by neglect, two counts of child cruelty in relation to Nafahat, and a third count of child cruelty in relation to another child. A jury found her guilty on Friday of all four counts after deliberating for nearly nine hours. Judge Rosa Dean told Jamal, who wept as the verdicts were read, it was highly likely she would receive a custodial sentence. The -year-old was released on bail ahead of sentence at the same court on  April. title: postman shares p written front
story: Postman shares why the P is written on the front of letters leaving Brits amazedAfter Brits shared their theories of why postmen write ‘P on front of their letters, an actual postie has revealed the real reasonA postman shared on Reddit that the ‘P’ just helps them track when theres parcels coming Image: Moment Editorial Getty ImagesByLayla NicholsonKatie L WilsonNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA curious bunch of Brits have started to wonder why some of their Royal Mail post arrives with the letter aposPapos scribbled across it when they receive letters through the door.And, it turns out this isnapost an accident, the Daily Star reports.The letter ‘P’, which is sometimes found inked onto the front of the envelope, actually has some signicance. But, what does the letter stand for  Many Reddit users have theorised as to why theyaposve found a letter aposPapos scribbled onto their letters. One person fretted: “Itaposs what thieves use to mark your house to let others know you have expensive dogs.”  Another user giggled: “Very subtle Wordle clue - takes  days then you just rearrange them. Never right.” But there is nothing to fear as it has nothing to do with criminal markings or even a show of dislike towards you from your local postman. In fact, the ‘P’ is an important signier allowing your postman to do their job correctly and efficiently, making sure you get all your deliveries on time.  Luckily, a postman on Reddit reassured the masses that the ‘P’ just helps them and their fellow postmans track when there are parcels coming. They explained: “You had a packet parcel. Stops us from forgetting about it!” And another reiterated the point: “Itaposs the postieaposs way of reminding themselves that when they come to post your letter thereaposs also a parcel for you. Thataposs so they donapost post your letter then find out halfway down the street they forgot to knock and give you your parcel. “Or sometimes theyaposll write P or something on the previous letter - that lets them know they have a parcel for next doorbut no letter.” So that is the answer for the mystery ‘P’ - just a reminder for postmen that they have a parcel to deliver as well as a letter. title: pub landlord scathing response diner
story: Pub landlord in scathing response to diner who left vicious Tripadvisor reviewA diner who visited the Fox Inn in Lower Chaddesley, Worcestershire, left an anonymous one-star review, calling it the worst carvery he had ever visitedThe Fox Inn, in Lower Chaddesley, near Kidderminster, is one of the most highly rated restaurants in the townByDayna Farrington:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA pub landlord hit back at a reviewer with a clever response after the punter claimed their restaurant was the “worst carvery ever”. A diner who visited the Fox Inn in Lower Chaddesley, Worcestershire, left an anonymous one-star review, calling it the worst carvery he had ever visited - with the beef being tough and very fatty.The diner’s review of the pub, which, with a four-star rating on Tripadvisor is one of the most highly rated restaurants in the town, prompted the owner of The Fox Inn to respond and call the review “suspicious”. The mean-spirited reviewer went as far to say he would not have given it [the meal] to my dog - and that he would not be ing, Birmingham Live reports. Their review was titled Warning!!! The worst carvery I have ever had!!! It said: This was possibly the worst carvery I have ever had. The beef was inedible it was tough and very fatty I ended up not eating it.  I am surprised the man had the front to serve it to me I would not of given it to my dog! So I ended up having a lovely meal of cold vegetables and under cooked roast potatoes. You get what you pay for I guess. I shall not be ing. But Ben Giles, the owner of The Fox Inn, responded to the review saying he was glad” the diner wouldn’t be coming back. Mr Gilesapos response said: Thank you for taking your time to dream and write this delightful review up, I’m so glad you won’t be coming back, that’s probably the most viable comment you have made. Our beef is certied Aberdeen Angus from Millers of Speyside so what youaposre saying is a bulls**t. We do around , meals a week and all our regular honest customers love it. My only thought is that this review seems a bitsuspicious but to give you the benefit of the doubt I wish you all the best in your future dining experiences. The Fox Inn regularly receives rave reviews on Tripadvisor from customers. Including one diner who visited in January saying it was fantastic every time. They said: I have eaten here many times with friends, family and as a couple and have always had fantastic service and food. Lots of choice. Always clean and attentive staff. Another added: The pub was clean and welcoming. Staff were well presented and friendly, as well as very helpful. Food was outstanding, the best carvery I have ever visited. Will be ing. While Isabelle said after her visit in February: Amazing staff, amazing food and amazing value for money. Couldn’t recommend more cant wait to come back!!! By far the best pub we have been to in the Kidderminster area. title: putin must held account unforgivable
story: Putin must be held to account for an unforgivable assault that will cost many livesVladimir Putin has been slammed by leaders and citizens around the world for the Russian invasion into Ukraine which is expected to displace up to four million in total " content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _JS.jpg" width"" "" The Mirror readers condemn Putins calamitous miscalculation in invading Ukraine is backfiring badly now and say the world is uniting against him Image: ALEXEY NIKOLSKY Sputnik AFP via Getty ImagesopinionByVoice of the Mirror:,  Feb |commentsVlad must be judged With sanctions tightening, the EU closing airspace to Russian flights and Ukrainians fighting so valiantly to defend their country, Vladimir Putin is on the rack. Putin raised the awful spectre of nuclear confrontation because he’s losing, or at least not winning as easily as he expected. His calamitous miscalculation in invading Ukraine is backfiring badly now, and the world is uniting against him. He faces a battle at home too, as anti-war protests swell in Moscow and other cities. The pressure on Putin must be intensied, never relaxed, until he has withdrawn the last of his forces from the country he attacked.  And then he must face judgement. He must be held to account for an unforgivable assault that will cost many lives on both sides, including civilians. Many more are being forced to flee their homes in terror. Britain has sent military equipment and is picking up speed on sanctions but much more can be done to help Ukraine. Oligarchs close to Putin must be pursued relentlessly. And we should take in our share of Ukrainian refugees.  Plane  simple Lting remaining Covid travel restrictions, particularly the bureaucratic passenger locator forms, could ease flying without endangering public health. The evidence proving they helped reduce virus infections is almost non-existent. On the other hand, dropping a demand that the unvaccinated entering Britain take a test to prove they’re Covid-free is arguably more controversial. We deserve to see the science guiding Government decisions, because a resurgence of the virus would be terrible. The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  Let’s blast off Extracting oxygen from lunar rocks could help humans live on the Moon. And with an unhinged tyrant threatening to unleash his arsenal of nuclear weapons on this planet, the Moon sounds like the safest place to be in the near future. title: smirnoff vodka uk russian roots
story: Who makes Smirnoff vodka and where is the drink made - as Russian vodka imports stopSupermarkets and booze-selling stores around the world have taken down several Russian-made vodkas from their shelves in response to Russias brutal invasion of Ukraine. Amid the boycotts, many are wonderingvodka brand Smirnoff is Russian - heres everything you need to knowSmirnoff vodka is not made in Russia contrary to popular belief Image: LightRocket via Getty ImagesByMalvika PadinTrends Writer:,  Mar |commentsRussia is famous around the world for its vodka. However, countries like the US and Canada have withdrawn Russian spirits from their bars and liquor stores, in solidarity with Ukraine. With such boycotts and bans of Russian brands taking place, many people will be left confused over which brands they should buy and which ones they should dodge amid Russiaaposs invasion of Ukraine.When we think of vodka, Smirnoff, which is one of the world’s best-selling vodka brands, will always come to mind. But is Smirnoff a Russian-made vodka brand  While many assume the popular beverage brand is Russian and with some even threatening to boycott it, itaposs important to note Smirnoff no longer has Russian owners. Hereaposs what you need to know.Where is vodka brand Smirnoff from and what are its origins   The Smirnoff vodka brand has its origins in Russia, with roots in Moscow, where Pyotr Arsenievich Smirnov founded a vodka distillery in . However, the beverage is not a Russian product anymore and now has UK owners. Smirnov’s distillery was also reportedly a favourite of the Russian royal family. However, after the vodka industry was nationalised in , Vladimir Smirnov, who was Pyotr’s third son, had to sell the distillery and the brand. In , Vladimir Smirnov sold the rights for their familyaposs vodka production to Russian-born businessman Rudolph Kunett, who came to New York in the s. Since then, the Smirnoff brand has changed hands several times over the years, and it is now owned by UK firm, Diageo. The manufacturer, which also owns the alcohol brand Guinness, has also announced that it has paused exports of its liquor to Russia. A Smirnoff spokesperson told Reuters: Our priority is the safety of our people in Ukraine and the wider region. Who makes Smirnoff vodka now  Though its roots are in Russia, Smirnoff vodka isn’t actually made in Russia today. While manufacturer Diageoaposs products, including Smirnoff vodka and other spirits, are manufactured in dferent parts of the world, the drink is not produced in Russia. The countries Smirnoff gets produced in includes the UK, United States, Ireland, Italy, Brazil and Latvia. Which vodka brands are Russian   Just like Smirnoff, many popular brands of vodka in the UK are actually not made in Russia anymore. For instance, Stoli is produced in Latvia after the owner of the company had a falling out with the Kremlin. One of the only brands that are still owned by Russia is Russian Standard. It is owned by Roustam Tariko, a Russian oligarch. This brand has been banned by Co-op and Morrisons, according to their spokesperson. A Co-op spokesperson told Reuters: In response to the ongoing invasion of Ukraine by Russian forces and as a sign of solidarity with the people of Ukraine weaposve taken the decision to remove from sale Russian-made Vodka. story: Tiny premature baby as big as can of Coke fighting for le in hospitalLittle Elli Robertson was born at  weeks on February , and is receiving care at Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Glasgow, but she is so small she can only be handled a few times every dayElli arrived  weeks early - but her parents refused to give up hope Image: Daily RecordByGemma RyderSam Elliott-GibbsReporter:,  Mar |comments A -week old baby born the size of a Coke can is battling for le following an intense four-day labour.Caitlyn Robertson gave birth to tiny Elli  weeks early on February , with her daughter weighing just lb  oz. The -year-oldaposs waters broke unexpectedly on February , but doctors were certain the child would not survive so waited for a natural birth, the DailyRecord reports.The tot was so small she would not have survived a C-section at Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Glasgow, Scotland. Just a few days after being born, Elli suffered a grade  bleed to the brain.Doctors have told parents Caitlyn and Jordan that their daughter will be left with some form of disability as a result. The couple already share two other children, Oliver, , and Hunter,  months. Caitlyn also experienced a premature birth with Hunter, who arrived at  weeks old, but he was very healthy and quickly went home.Caitlyn said: Her first scan was clear but she suffered this bleed on day three. Itaposs the highest grade of bleed and she will have some form of disability but we wonapost know what that is until she gets older. The bleed could stay the same or get worse or she might not make it all - itaposs a lot to take in. As well as the bleed to her brain, Elli is also battling a skin infection and staff are carefully monitoring the totaposs weight, which has dropped from g at birth to just g. Ellie is now so small she can only be handled just a few times a day, with medics ready to step inher weight drops further. Despite her challenges, tiny Elli is defying odds every day and is now miraculously breathing without the help of a ventilator. Caitlyn added: Itaposs a long journey ahead but sheaposs defied the odds so far. At first she needed a ventilator to breathe but sheaposs doing it on her own now, and sheaposs moved on to getting treatment to help keep her lungs open to make it easier for her. She is just so tiny that itaposs really hard to hold her as something could break so sheaposs only handled every six hours. Me and my husband have only held her once and she weighs little more than a can of coke. Sheaposs the size of an average hand. She explained: We have two wee boys so we canapost just spend all day at the hospital with Elli which is very hard. title: uks very kremlin residents shocked
story: UKs very own Kremlin - as residents shocked about Russian Embassys house in KentThe Seacox Heath is found between Flimwell and Hawkhurst near the border between Kent and East Sussex - it is , miles away from the actual Kremlin in MoscowThis  photo shows what the property looks like Image: Courtesy of University of St Andrews LibraryByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments These images show the UKaposs very own Kremlin nestled in Kent as shocked residents say they knew nothing about the Russian Embassyaposs country house.The Seacox Heath is found between Flimwell and Hawkhurst near the border between Kent and East Sussex.As Russiaaposs unjustied invasion of Ukraine wages on for the eighth day, residents were surprised to learn of a link to Vladimir Putinaposs regime hiding in the greenery of the countryside.The property is , miles away from the actual Kremlin in Moscow and a half-mile beyond the small black gated entrance is a lavish grade-II listed castle built in the th century. This country house estate is that of Russian diplomats.For all the live updates from the Russian invasion follow our live blog  The house was built in  and presented to the Soviet Government by the English Lord Gushen as a gt following the Second World War after Russian sailors saved his son during the battle. Eliza Hart, , said she was completely unaware of the diplomatic grounds.She told KentOnline : I drive up and down that road so much, but had no idea what was there. I thought it was just housed along there but to hear what it actually is quite a surprise. Itaposs quite crazy really to think you can live somewhere for so long and not really know what or who is living in the same area. Engineer Paul Hurst, from Flimwell, added: Itaposs hidden away pretty well with all the woodlands and no signs on the road, but I guess why would you signpost it   The prestigious building was built by the first leader of the Hawkhurst gang before it was rebuilt decades later. The notorious gang was led by Arthur Gray and had a nasty reputation that went from Deal all the way down to the Dorset coast. They have been described as the aposMafiaapos of the early th century. They were initially supported by the poor in the area as they offered employment. The gang was involved in smuggling from the South East from  until . Gray and Thomas Kingsmill were executed in  and  after they lost a battle with the Goudhurst Militia. title: uk weather forecast 5c arctic
story: UK weather forecast: -C Arctic freeze to hit this weekend ahead of snow and galesThe Met office is predicting a bitterly cold weekend with temperatures dropping as low -C while there are freezing conditions up and down the country before snow and gales next weekThe UK is set for a frosty weekend Image: PAByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Brits are set for a -C freeze this weekend with sub zero temperatures likely for most of the country before snow gales arrive, said the Met Office. Bitterly cold conditions are expected for Saturday morning as a weather front comes in from the east and the wintry conditions are expected to continue well into the middle of March.People are being warned to wrap up warm over the coming days while the weather becomes more unsettled by the middle of next week and less predictable. Maps from WXCharts show the icy conditions continuing for the next couple of weeks and the Met Office is warning of snow and gales. Met Office forecaster Alex Deakin said that a high pressure is trying to push in from the Atlantic which would mean clear skies and sunshine but another weather front is sticking on the east of the country that is bringing cloud and rain.  The temperatures will be cold especially overnight. “It will turn frosty, patchy frost for north west England, Wales and maybe even south west England as well, said Mr Deakin. Under the cloud and rain with that weather front the temperatures will hold up a few degrees above freezing but where certainly getting close to freezing even in towns and cities, and in rural parts we will be well below, maybe -C in one or two locations across Scotland and Northern Ireland. There is likely to be a east-west ide with cloud and rain to the east of the country where a weather front persists. Mr Deakin continued: A cold start hereto the weekend, a frosty old start but we should see plenty of sunshine, maybe a little bit of morning fog in a few spots. Sunny spells too for Wales and western England.  It’s further east where we are going to have this cloud and rain. Now some uncertainty about how far it is going to creep, whether the rain is going to come and go all day or whether it will be stuck under persistent rain but there is the threat of that certainly for east Yorkshire, Lincolnshire, East Anglia and the South East. It looks pretty damp here. He added: Under the cloud in the east  or C maybe squeezing up to C in Norwich and London, that is going to feel grim for the time of year. It is a similar picture for Sunday although there is likely to be more sun in the east with the high pressure finally taking over.  For next week the icy conditions remain with the threat of wind and snow as the weather becomes less settled. The Met Office states: Sunny spells with some cloud for most at first during this period, with generally stronger winds than previous days and the ongoing risk of gales in the far west and northwest. Temperatures looking to be rather below normal and perhaps feeling cooler in the wind. Through the period, frontal systems push eastwards which are likely to bring strengthening winds in addition to potential snowfall. The main impacts are likely to be from heavy rain and gales during this time. Nearer to the end of this period, there is looking to be a transition from these rather cold conditions to near normal and milder conditions. This is likely to include clearer weather with showers across all areas. UK forecast for the next  days Today: Cloud and occasional rain in the southeast moving into central areas of England. Drier and brighter for parts of East Anglia later. Mainly dry with sunny spells where. Tonight: Dry with clear periods and widespread frost in north, with some freezing fog patches. Cloud and outbreaks rain extending westwards across central and southern Britain. Sunday: Dry and sunny in north. Rather cloudy across central and southern areas with outbreaks of rain across West Midlands and southern Wales. Isolated showers possible in southeast during the afternoon. Outlook for Monday to Wednesday: Rather cold with overnight frost but largely dry with sunny spells for most on Monday and Tuesday. Turning windier and potentially milder into Wednesday, rain possible in the west. title: woman 107 says favourite boozy
story: Woman, , says favourite boozy drink is secret to long le as it keeps her youngViolet Shipp, who was born during the First World War, marked her th birthday with a glass of her favourite drink - Cinzano and Lemonade - as she was joined by friends at her Essex care homeViolet Shipp enjoyed a birthday tipple of Cinzano and Lemonade on her th birthday Image: Eastnews Press AgencyByAdam AspinallNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Bubbly Bubbly Violet Shipp has celebrated her th birthday and puts her incredible age down to - Cinzano and Lemonade. The centenarian, born during the First World War, marked the special occasion with a glass of her favourite drink as she was joined by friends at her Essex care home.The former civil servant revealed she does not feel her incredible age and admitted she’d rather be living an independent le at homeshe could. The celebrations marked the end of a busy week for the perky pensioner who attended a special service attended by Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall as Southend was officially granted city status at a celebration of the le of Sir David Amess.  Violet, who was one of five children, said: “I was telling the girls here yesterday that I only feel . “I do love a Cinzano and lemonade, I like the sweetness as I definitely have a sweet tooth. “I think it helps keep me young. “Unfortunately I don’t have it every day but it’s nice as a treat. I used to enjoy a hot toddy too.” Violet has a passion for horse racing and used to be a regular at Fontwell racecourse in West Sussex with her late husband Benjamin, who she was married to for  years. Staff at Elizabeth House care home in Benfleet have organised a trip to Chelmsford Racecourse for the residents and Violet will be joining them trackside. “I do like to have a bet on the horses, nothing too much but it makes it all a bit of fun. I love all horse racing, especially the national hunt and the meetings at Cheltenham and the Grand National,” she added. Violet, born in London when King George V was king, received another birthday card from The Queen, her fourth one, to add to those she was sent on her th, th and th birthdays. Violet was born in London in , sister to George, Lilian, Sidney and Peter and grew up up in Blackfriars before moving to Herne Hill . She eventually moved to Orpington, Kent, and then Bognor Regis, West Sussex, before she she ended up in Benfleet about  years ago. During the Second World War she helped to make valves for Phillips. Violet, who does not have any children, has also been in a choir, singing popular and gospel music and she still enjoys singing and dancing especially to the wartime music of the s. Alex Sanders, deputy manager at Elizabeth House, revealed Violet is an inspiration to residents and staff alike. “She really is lovely - I’ve never known anyone this old. “It’s also amazing how agile she still. We have five residents who turn  this year, so they’re doing really well.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON CinzanoCamilla, Duchess of CornwallThe QueenPrince Charles, Prince of WalesWorld War World War IRoyal FamilyCare homesCivil servantsNursing homesHorsesDaily MirrorPensioner" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. story: Dad zapped with Taser SEVEN times after challenging airport to fight during rowWARNING: STRONG LANGUAGE Ryan Austin Marinis, , was seen behaving in an erratic manner and police later said he had fought with his we and pushed his six-year-old daughter before he was TaseredRyan Austin Martin, , became aggressive at Orlando International Airport Image: Jessica Smith YouTubeBySofie JacksonVideo News ReporterGraeme Murray:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar A dad was Tasered seven times when he allegedly became violent after a row with his we. Ryan Austin Martin, , is accused of trying to punch down a door at an airport and challenging other bystanders to a fight as he swaggered about the airport. His alleged actions were caught on camera and police later said he also fought with his we and pushed his six-year-old daughter.A clip, posted on YouTube by Jessica Smith, shows Martin challenging others to a fight at Orlando International Airport in Florida, US.Martin seemed angered by others filming his behaviour, and said: You want to see a show  Iaposm gonna f***ing put on a show. He then hammered a door with his fists before bellowing: Who wants to fight  Letaposs go! To someone off-screen, he warned: Yo, pal. Donapost even think of coming over here. story: Man Who Bought Hoarders Home Makes Thousands After Discovering Incredible Treasures Inside" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _JS.jpg" width"" "" Alex Archbold has bought and sold antiques since aged nine Image: Curiosity Incorporated YoutubeByLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA man who bought a hoarderaposs house for a mere £, has hit the jackpot making almost £, by selling the items inside.Alex Archbold snapped up the hoarderaposs paradise and its contents blind after the previous owner died in December . The antique dealer, who has been in the business from the tender age of nine, had never seen the property but has developed a knack for treasure hunting.After taking the gamble, he realised he had stumbled upon a treasure trove full of rare and highly collectable pieces worth thousands of pounds. Speaking on his YouTube channel Curiosity Incorporated, he said: The person who lived here was really into fashion so there is a really good chance that some of these items may be designer.  So this is going to be an exploration, going through all of this stuff. Thataposs what weaposre all about here. The businessman, from Edmonton in Alberta, Canada, went on to uncover a haul of vintage Chanel clothing, Burberry boxes and Tfany jewellery at the former piano teacheraposs home. Look at the dust, he commented as he began his tour of the house which was stacked from floor to ceiling in every room with bags, boxes and trinkets.  Wardrobes and cupboards appeared to be full to the brim with designer clothes.While where in the property were wallets full of cash, bags of gold and diamond rings, he told Bored Panda.“It was in an extreme state of hoarding. In fact, the only reason I bought the contents was because I thought it might be a fun adventure for our YouTube channel and at very least, I would get a grand piano, he told the publication.  It was impossible to see what was in the house because of how full it was at the time. Places were piled up to the ceiling. “Little did I know that the eccentric piano teacher I had met was, in fact, a millionaire. Alex was confident that the items would have real monetary value and sorted through the hoard. He believes he has made more than £, after purchasing the property at auction and said it is his best investment to date.  The antique fanatic described its late owner as a fun, patient and well-travelled lady - he added has decided to keep her grand piano in her memory. He revealed what initially drew him into the property to keep her memory going. Former owner Bette-Joan Rac passed away aged  in November . title: brian cox says doesnt believe
story: Brian Cox says he doesnt believe in aliens as humans are alone in this galaxyPopular telly physicist Brian Cox, , said it is unlikely that aliens exist because the chances of sophisticated le evolving like humans have are simply too lowBrian Cox does not believe in aliens Image: BBCByAdam AspinallNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Brainbox professor Brian Cox does not believe in aliens, he has revealed.The popular telly physicist argues it is unlikely they exist because the chances of sophisticated le evolving like humans have are simply too low. Instead he believes ‘there’s probably nothing ’ and that we are the only civilisation in this galaxy, at least. The -year-old boffin explained that, because it took so long for humans to evolve from a single cell in such extraordinary circumstances, he doesn’t think it has been repeated. Speaking to Noble Rot magazine, he said: “You can confine the argument to the galaxy, to the Milky Way, because we’re never going to contact anything outside that and nothing’s ever contacting us from dferent galaxies. “But in a galaxy, there are  billion stars and more planets than that... I think there are no civilisations out there. “It took . billion years to go from the origin of le on the planet to a civilisation, and that’s a long time. It’s a third of the age of the universe.  “The universe has only been around for . billion years and, as sun-like stars typically last for four or five billion years, there’s a window of stability. “So it takes four or five billion years to go from a single cell to civilisation, and stars really don’t remain stable on timescales much longer than that. “The biologists I know think that it was such a freak occurrence that anything got multicellular. There’s probably nothing . “I’ve got one friend who likes to say that all there will be out there is slime at best.” Cox said the possibility that we’re alone in this galaxy should not depress us. He said: “What does it mean to live a finite, fragile le in an infinite eternal universe  Well, meaning is a property of le and intelligence. “So I’d say thatwe are the only civilisation in the Milky Way now, then Earth is the only island of meaning in a sea of  billion stars. “So that is either frightening or, well, at the same time gives you a sense of our value. “I would say the universe is meaningless without le.” Asked in the pastbelieves alien le could exist Professor Cox has not denied it but rather thinks that the chances of a hi-tech civilisation emerging in our galaxy are very slim. He has previously explained: “I tend to restrict myself to the galaxy, as I do think it’s possible that at the moment that there is just one civilisation in the Milky Way, and that’s us.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Brian CoxAliensDaily Mirror,callToAction:ltpgtGet weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emaillt pgt,buttonText:,contentId:,newsletterImage:https:i-prod.mirror article.ece ALTERNATES sd _AlisonHeaderFinal.png,endpointUrl:https:response.pure interface list.php,profile:Reach_Mirror,isPureNewsLetter:true,pureMailingListId:Mirror - Alisons Newsletter,isDoubleOptIn:,newsletterSiteName:Mirror" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get weekly highlights from Mirror editor Alison Phillips direct to your emailInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: cheese lovers astounded after learning
story: Cheese lovers astounded after learning theyve been grating backwards for yearsA number of cheese lovers have been left re-evaluating their kitchen skills after learning theyve been grating blocks of cheese backward for their entire lives, and the proper way is so much simplerA number of viewers were very surprised indeed Image: toddy_ tiktokByJulia BanimAudience Writer:,  Mar |comments Grating cheese is undoubtedly one of the most enjoyable kitchen tasks, giving you plenty of excuses to pick away a bit as you cook.However, as fun as this may be, a large number of us have apparently been using our handheld graters in completely the aposwrongapos way. When using a hand-held cheese grater, many of us would simply hold the cheese aloft and grate it from above, the shreds tumbling downwards onto your plate or chopping board. For countless home chefs, this way is the only way, and theyaposve never even so much as considered another method.Now a mum has come forward to demonstrate what she believes is the aposcorrectapos way with a TikTok video that has clocked up .K likes - and her followers have been left aghast. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.In the clip, the TikToker - who goes by the username toddy_ - can be seen about to grate cheese while prepping for a delicious family meal of ricotta cheese and butternut squash ravioli in a butter sauce.She revealed: I was today years old when I learned how to use a hand-held cheese grater. The mum then demonstrates the method of cheddar shredding sheaposs always used, before showing a better way. Holding the cheese firmly down on the chopping board, while positioning the grater at the end, the woman showed how you could grate cheese so much faster, and it works better. Her followers were blown away by this game-changing tactic, with one person gasping, So Iaposve been cutting my finger knees all these years for no reason ! Another wrote: And they have the audacity to not put instructions with these. I feel bamboozled. While a third lamented: Iaposve wasted my whole le and for what  Unfortunately, the home cook had to field off some criticism from people that she was using a garlic mincer or a lemon zester in her clip, which she strongly refuted in follow-up vids. As she explained: No, that is not a zester. You guys might use it as a zester, which is fine. We use ours as a cheese grater. We do use a micro blader though as a zester for oranges, lemons, and garlic. This is a better thing to use anyways as a zester.Do you have an interesting food story or le hack to share  We pay for stories. news weird-news i-treat-cow-though-were-"Arkansas woman cares for her house-trained pet cowByJulia BanimAudience WriterAmy Walters:,  Mar |comments A woman has shared her adventures of living with a house cow called Ferdinand, and has gone as far as to describe the animal as being like her son. Faith OaposShields Allen, from the US state of Arkansas, has risen to TikTok fame after sharing an insight into her le with her adorable pet, a -month-old cow named Ferdinand.Alongside her father, the -year-old office worker runs a hobby farm and five-acre ranch, with the pair raising and breeding miniature cows to be kept as pets. Faith lets Ferdinand live inside her house, just as though he were a dog or cat, and sheaposs even taken the time to potty-train him. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Faith said: “Anyone who owns a pet of any kind knows that there’s a special bond formed between you and your pet. This feeling is amplied greatly when you’re raising an animal on a bottle. Ferdinand truly sees me as his mother and always will be my son. He follows me everywhere and always wants to be right with me – usually licking my face. When he sees me, he ‘moos’ to get my attention and keeps doing this until I come to see him. Ferdinand was born to one of Faith’s other cows, Dutch, and - although he may not be aware of it - his sweet and loveable nature has earned him , besotted TikTok followers. In a recent video, which has clocked up . million times and . million likes, Faith reveals a little more about the beautul cowaposs background and cushy lestyle, all while young Ferdinand posed for the camera in a fetching blue and white jumper. In written text overlaying the video, Faith said: “When you were born on a farm and your mom didn’t want you so a girl in her s took you home, and now you’re a house cow who wears sweaters, takes baths, and sleeps with a heated blanket. In the clip, Ferdinand looks to be around the same size as an average dog, with his pointy ears being just a little bit lower than the door handle in the background. One viewer remarked: “He’s living that cowdashian dream. While another commented: “Cows are honestly the most kind-hearted, loving animals out there. Opening up about the challenges of keeping a pet cow, Faith added: “Ferdinand stayed on a pretty consistent potty schedule and always went shortly after he finished his bottle. This allowed us time to get him outside, like potty training a dog. I lost some sleep waking up during the night to give him his bottles, but I wouldn’t call that a challenge. His sweet face and seeing how happy he was, made it more than worth it. Although, we were not prepared [for this] as we assumed his mother would care for him. After a dficult delivery, this wasn’t the case as she wanted nothing to do with him and we had to bottle feed him so he would survive. He was like a perfect baby – after the first week or so, he slept through the night.Do you have an unusual pet story to share  We pay for stories. title: i want name twins after
story: I want to name my twins after Harry Potter characters - but some say its cruelA dad-to-be has said he wants to name his twins after Harry Potter characters, but was met with backlash online from people who think hes burdening his kidsThe dad-to-be wants to use Harry Potter-inspired names for his twinsImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |comments Some new parents have baby names picked out for years before they welcome a little one into the world, and for others, the naming process takes a little bit more thought.And while inspiration can come from a number of dferent places, itaposs important to think about how your child might be perceived by othersthey end up being named after a hugely popular fictional character.One dad-to-be has sparked debate on Reddit after he claimed he was thinking of naming his children after Harry Potter characters, especially as he had already spoken to his we about the idea - who had expressed her disapproval.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. The man explained he and his we are currently expecting twins, and his plan was to name them Lily and Mollythey were girls, after Lily Potter, the mother of the main character Harry, and Molly Weasley, the mother of Harryaposs best friend Ron.Butthe pair have twin boys, the dad had other ideas - as he wanted to name them Fred and George, after the Weasley twins and older brothers of Ron. He explained: So my we is pregnant and weaposre having twins. I suggested the names Fred and Georgethey are both boys and Lily and Molly for girls. My we is okay with Lily and Molly since we both have multiple deceased relatives in extended families with those names and it would be honouring them first and book names later.  But she called me an a**hole for wanting to name our kids after some book characters and would not discuss why. I honestly donapost understand her point of view, since itaposs not on the nose like Krum, Filch, or Dumbledore. Commenters on the post were ided over the topic, as some disagreed with the manaposs suggestion that Fred and George were not on the nose - especially as the characters are twins in the franchise, so anyone who has read the books or seen the films would likely be able to make the connection. One person said: You are being disingenuous about how the names arenapost on the nose. Every time your sons would be introduced together, they would have to deal with the painfully obvious realisation that you named them after Harry Potter. They will be people that have embarrassing names when theyaposre together.  As another wrote: Do you really think that wouldnapost be obvious to literally everyone  Do you want them to spend their whole lives having people wince when they hear their names and express sympathy for how cringey their childhoods must have been  Itaposs absolutely on the nose. And a third posted: You do not want to burden your kids with names that are very recognisable from books or films. Also, Fred dies in the book, how do you think that will affect the kid you name Fred  Donapost live out your fantasies through your children. But other commenters didnapost see the problem with the names and said it was perfectly okay for the man to suggest the monikers as long as he respected his weaposs opinion too. Someone said: You are allowed to want to name your kids whatever but your both have to agree. But in the same breath, she said she didn’t like Fred and George so that’s not on the table anymore. If you expect her to respect you not liking a name you have to show her the same. While someone  added: Honestly I wonapost shame anyone for considering naming their child after something they love. But be reasonable and mostly reflect on how said name will affect your children. Kids can be mean like no other. The man later ed to the post to clary that he wasnapost forcing the names on his we, and theyaposre already in discussion about dferent monikers instead. He wrote: I already dropped Fred and George when she objected. It was just that when I first suggested she immediately called me an a**hole, thus the post.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON RedditHarry PotterTwinsParentingUmm what " data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news i-went-date-tinder-match-"TikTok user recalls the worst date shes ever been onByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |comments With more and more of us turning to online dating to try and find love, there are an increasing number of people finding themselves victims of catfishes when they think theyaposve found the perfect partner.A catfish is described as a person who pretends to be someone theyaposre not on the internet, and theyaposre often found on dating websites where they use misleading pictures to pose as someone .And one woman on TikTok knows all too well what itaposs like to deal with a catfish, as she recently went on a disastrous date with a man sheaposd met on Tinder - who turned out to be someone completely dferent.Valeria Drovna, who is from the US, explained the bloke she matched with had weird edits on most of his pictures and bragged about his height, so she already had suspicions before meeting him in person. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here.In the clip, which was posted to her @valeriadrovna account, she said: I have to rant about the worst date Iaposve ever been on and ask why men are such filthy little liars.So I met this guy on Tinder, we can call him Dan. All of his pictures were mirror selfies with weird edits and really that should have been my first red flag but hey, redaposs always been my favourite colour, so I kept talking to him. He eventually brings up how heaposs apos which is completely irrelevant to me because Iaposm vertically challenged and I do not care, but aside from that comment, the conversation was okay, so when he asks to take me out and show me a good time, I say yes. He tells me that heaposs just moved to a city near mine and I agreed to meet halfway, but he rejects every restaurant I bring up over two days. Eventually, he says we have to try this one gelato place. So I say okay, sure. And I drove  minutes to go meet him.  When Valeria arrived at the location for their date, she was confused when she seemed unable to find Dan - until she realised she was looking for a completely dferent person. And things only went from bad to worse when they went to get their gelato and Valeriaaposs date acted completely inappropriately when he discovered how unhealthy the sweet treat was. She added: When I get there, I get out of my car to look for him because he says heaposs already there, but I canapost find anybody in the line or in the car park that looks anything like his pictures. So I texted him and Iaposm like, where are you  And I get a tap on my shoulder, turn around and am at eye level with a man who is a completely dferent race than the one Iaposve been speaking to for the last couple of weeks. Instead of leaving, I go, Oh, I didnapost recognise you. To which he goes, aposYeah, women donapost like brown guys. So I edit my pictures online.apos To which I should have said no, sir, women donapost like you because youaposre a liar. But I digress and I lined up for gelato with him anyway.  He tells me to order first and doesnapost offer to pay so I get a small lemon gelato. I look over at him and he goes, aposDonapost worry, Iaposm going to pay for my own.apos And we go sit down. He takes one bite of his gelato and goes aposoh, this is unhealthy for you.apos And I go aposYeah, itaposs chocolate.apos He then stands up, throws his entire gelato into the trash can, and I sit and I wonder what Iaposm doing with my le. Just when Valeria thought things couldnapost get any weirder, she agreed to go for a walk with Dan who spent time ranting about his family and even found time to call his date poor for being interested in kayaking. Valeria managed to end the date by rejecting Danaposs offer to meet up again, and when she got home, she received a text message from him telling her she was ugly anyway. She said: Because I want to finish my gelato, I agree to go for a walk along the docks. And the whole time he rants about how he hates his mother because she left him and how dating has never worked out for him before. But now itaposs okay because we finally found each other. To change the subject, I point out a kayak and say aposhey, Iaposve always wanted to try that.apos To which he goes, aposNo, kayaks are for poor people.aposI say Iaposm going to go back to my car because itaposs going to rain soon, and he says aposno,you knew anything about the weather, youaposd know that the clouds need to be going in the opposite direction, so youaposre going to keep walking.aposTo which I say sir, Iaposm now going in the opposite direction. I make it to my car, reject his second date offer, and then get a text saying I was ugly anyway when I get home.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON ViralUmm what Dating" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news weird-news my-boss-sacked-after-finding-"TikToker is fired after her boss finds out about her OnlyFansByJulia BanimAudience WriterOlive Loveridge-Greene:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Former marketing manager Annabelle Knight started up an OnlyFans account back in September , hoping to save enough money to get on the property ladder. However, she never anticipated just how successful her side project would be. Within the space of just one month, Annabelle, from Brisbane, Australia, raked in thousands of pounds. She continued to pursue her lucrative side hustle for the next  months in addition to her full-time job, bringing in an extra £, each month on average. However, everything changed when - less than one week after starting a new marketing role - the -year-old was sacked after a colleague reportedly came across her X-rated content and told on her. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Looking back on her dismissal, Annabelle is now quite pleased about how things turned out, with her earnings now adding up to around £ a day. Annabelle said: I am pleased to [have been fired] an extent, I’m a lot happier now and have a lot more freedom. Iaposm earning a considerable amount more now than I was at the other job. The morning of the firing I was askedI had any other side businesses and I said no, assuming she [my manager] meant retail side businesses that were tax-deductible. I also couldnapost think of how sheaposd found my OnlyFans as at that stage it was completely unsearchable and Iaposd capped my fans at around , where theyaposd been sitting for about a year. I was sent an email giving me an opportunity to explain myself. Theyaposd written all the reasons why they thought I deserved to have my position terminated. I couldnapost believe it. Annabelle has explained that she was given three reasons for her firing, which included publishing content to an online site with pornographic images, carrying out business without her employeraposs approval, and ly advising her company she had no side sources of income. She believes that one of her co-workers was among her subscribers and that they were the one to show their boss her spicy pictures. Annabelle continued: I didnapost promote my OnlyFans anywhere so I can only assume that someone at my work was subscribed to my OnlyFans and sent the evidence into my boss. It made me furious that someone at the company who subscribed to my page then re-shared my content. She went on to add that a simple conversation would have sufficed. Although the firing came as a shock, Annabelle is now pulling in much more money than she did previously, as she previously earned AUD , a yearat her old marketing job, while she now makes up to , a week , and only has to work around six hours a day.Do you have a similar story to share  We pay for stories. title: woman left flummoxed date dumps
story: Woman left flummoxed as date dumps her for eating Maltesers at the cinemaA mum has been left completely baffled after her date told her their romance wasnt going to work - because of her decision to eat Maltesers during a cinema tripThe woman was baffled by her dates high cinema standardsImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByZahna EklundAudience writer:,  Mar |comments When it comes to finding someone to settle down with, you ideally want to be with someone with whom you have things in common - whether that be in hobbies, entertainment, or food. And one woman on Mumsnet has found her date isnapost interested in playing around when it comes to cutting off people he doesnapost vibe with after he dumped her for eating Maltesers at the cinema. The mum explained her date had bought popcorn for himself while she had opted for a big bag of the malt chocolate treats - and in true cinema fashion, she had opened the bag and started tucking in before the film had started.But her decision to munch on her choccies early was apparently too much for her date to comprehend because he began getting irritated with her, and ultimately chose to dump her. Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. She said: Iaposve been seeing someone for a few weeks. We went to the cinema last night and he bought popcorn and I bought a big bag of Maltesers. I opened them when we sat down and began eating them. He said aposwhy don’t you wait until the film starts apos, so I just laughed and said apostoo temptingapos as a joke. He seemed irritated and said something like aposyou won’t have any left by time the film startsapos. This got my back up a bit and I just carried on as I was. I finished the bag around  minutes into the film. I saw him watching me and felt his disapproval, but why  It didn’t affect him, he had his popcorn. He was really grumpy throughout the film and afterwards was quite off with me. We were meant to be going for something to eat but he said he wasn’t really in the mood and would be heading home.  The woman then text the man at the end of the night to find out the cause of his change in attitude - and he told her he didnapost think their romance would work out. She added: Before I went to bed I text him askingI’d done something to upset him and he replied, aposI don’t think this will work out, it’s nothing personal.apos I replied, aposOk no worriesapos. It’s been bugging me all day as before we sat down in the cinema he was absolutely fine! We were laughing and joking, no bad feelings at all, and he literally changed as soon as we sat down. Commenters on the Mumsnet post were equally as baffled by the manaposs seemingly high standards, as many of them said she likely had a lucky escape by getting out of the romance quickly. One person wrote: If he dumped you over that, he was probably doing you a huge favour. If I buy popcorn at the cinema, at least half is gone before the film starts. As another said: By the sounds of it youaposve had a lucky escape! Who doesnapost eat at least half the snacks before the film starts!  While a third commented: He sounds awful! I thought everyone tucked into the snacks as soon as they sat down. But someone  disagreed, stating the Maltesers could have just been the last straw. They said: Sounds like it was the last straw, doubt it was over this sorry but sounds like he was already planning on dumping you and every little thing you do is irritating to him.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON DatingUmm what " data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: judge rules dog thats been
story: Judge rules dog that’s been barking ‘for  years’ is surrendered amid neighbourly rowJudge Mary Larkin has directed that Geraldine O’Loughlin deliver her "German Shepherd-like" dog to the dog warden, due to the continual noise disturbance on a neighbour in Ennis, Co Clare, in Ireland" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _Low-Angle-View-Of-German-Shepherd-Barking-In-Yard-Against-Sky.jpg" width"" "" Judge Larkin concluded that the barking dog is interfering substantially with Mr Shannon’s leImage: Getty Images EyeEm PremiumByGordon Deegan:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar A neighbourly row has come to a head as a judge has ordered the surrender of a dog that’s been barking for  years to the local dog warden. At Ennis District Court, Judge Mary Larkin has directed that Geraldine O’Loughlin deliver her German Shepherd-like dog to the dog warden, due to the continual noise disturbance on a neighbour in Ennis, Co Clare. Judge Larkin made the order in response to an application by Ms O’Loughlin’s neighbour, Shane Shannon of Gort Rd, Ennis, under legislation concerning the control of dogs.Judge Larkin concluded that the barking dog is interfering substantially with Mr Shannon’s le, The Irish Mirror reports. Judge Larkin made the order under a little known provision of the Control of Dogs Act  where a judge can make an order requiring the elimination of a nuisance caused by the “excessive barking” of an unwanted dog. In evidence, Mr Shannon said that the “large dog has been barking for as long as I have been there and that’s  years”.  Mr Shannon said that the dog’s barking would go on all day “for two and a half hour periods at a time”. He said: “The dog has been barking a hundred times a day.” Mr Shannon said that he spoke to Ms O’Loughlin about the dog but the barking continued. In response to his ‘barking concerns’ Mr Shannon said that Ms O’Loughlin told him that is what dogs do. Sure what harm is it” ” He told the court: “She laughed into my face.” Mr Shannon said that he works in horticulture and has a potting shed at the end of his garden but was forced to abandon working there due to the dog constantly barking from the garden next door. Mr Shannon said that the dog meet the definition of an ‘unwanted dog’ under the Act stating that the dog “hasn’t got much affection and I would say he is lonely and not cared for”. He said: “To be honest it is immensely upsetting to listen to an animal like that. He is fed twice a day when food is thrown out the back door to him. I never hear anyone playing with the dog or saying hello to the dog.” Mr Shannon said that the dog was never brought outside the garden over the past  years and never brought into the home. Asked by Judge Larkin what the dog’s name is, Mr Shannon said: “I never heard the dog being called by its name or heard anyone being nice to the dog.” At the outset of the case, Judge Larkin said that the court registrar received an email from Ms O’Loughlin stating that she wouldn’t be coming to court as the dog has been put down. However, Mr Shannon said that he would prefer to press ahead with the case stating “I don’t trust anything she says”. After hearing Mr Shannon’s evidence, Judge Larkin ordered that the dog delivered to the dog warden to be dealt with by him in accordance with Control of Dogs Act as it is an unwanted dog. news world-news putins-unlikely-celebrity-pals-whether-"Steven Seagal reveals shock friendship with Vladimir PutinByKyle OSullivanTV Features Writer:,  Mar |commentsVladimir Putin has made a lot of political enemies - but that hasnapost stopped him becoming friends with a number of celebrities.The Russian President likes to keep his personal le out of the limelight but always makes sure the cameras are there when heaposs meeting an A-lister. Putin was snapped with singer Paul McCartney before a concert in Moscow in , sat with actor Jack Nicholson at the Moscow International Film Festival in  and was even in correspondence with Pamela Anderson. He had drinks with Hollywood star Leonardo DiCaprio at the International Tiger Conservation Forum in Saint Petersburg in  and shook hands with British supermodel Naomi Campbell at the same event.As well as these celeb acquaintances, Putin has actually developed close friendships with a few Hollywood stars, who have been reacting to Russiaaposs war on Ukraine. Around the world, Putin is losing allies fast with many condemning his terrying invasion and attacks on defenceless civilians, with the Russian leader promising worse is yet to come.So how has this changed the way his famous friends think about him  Steven Seagal Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. Hollywood actor Steven Seagal has a surprising friendship with Putin - and has even been to his home. The Under Siege and Hard to Kill star, who received his Russian citizenship in , first bonded with the Russian leader over a shared love of martial arts. The Michigan-born actor has previously described his father as pure Russian, as his paternal grandparents were Russian Jewish immigrants, and he still has some relatives in the country.Unsurprisingly, Seagal did not put any blame on Putin over the Ukraine war and has claimed an outside entity is provoking both countries into fighting.The -year-old martial artist told Fox News Digital that he looks at both Russia and Ukraine as one family. Most of us have friends and family in Russia and Ukraine, he said on Monday as he refused to take sides. I look at both as one family and really believe it is an outside entity spending huge sums of money on propaganda to provoke the two countries to be at odds with each other. My prayers are that both countries will come to a positive, peaceful resolution where we can live and thrive together in peace.  Seagal has spoken out in praise of Putin on several occasions, including in a  interview with Russian TV channel RT when he said Putin was one of the greatest world leadersnot the greatest world leader alive today. He went on: The first time I went to his home, I walked in and saw a le-sized statue of Kano Jigoro, who is the founder of judo, so I was immediately taken and impressed and really wanting to get to know this man deeper and deeper. In , Seagal met with Belarusan president Alexander Lukashenko to eat carrots and chat about that yearaposs harvest. That year he was also granted his Russian citizenship, resulting in him being barred from entering Ukraine. This [was his] desire, he had really applied, Kremlin spokesperson Dmitry Peskov announced to the press. He had been really persistent for a long time and been asking to grant him citizenship, he is actually renowned for his quite warm feelings toward our country. He never made a secret out of it, at the same time he is quite famous, as you know, actor. In , Seagal appeared on Good Morning Britain live from Moscow to defend Putin amid claims he had influenced the American election.  Speaking about his Russian citizenship, he said: I have lots of relatives in Russia and you know I love Russia, I love the country, I love the people and, you know, I think that one thing that’s sort of not widely known, there are millions and millions of people in America who have dual and multiple citizenship so this is not an uncommon thing. The thing that makes it controversial is all of the propaganda flying, particularly from America about Russia, therefore it becomes kind of a controversial situation. He told Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid heaposd had many direct dealings with Putin as he lavished praise on the Russian leader. Seagal said: As I’ve said many times I think he’s one of the great world leaders, he’s brilliant, he’s articulate, he’s a great tactician. Him and I started out becoming friends over the martial arts. The martial arts has to do with a lot of things. It’s a philosophy, it gets into the history of tactics and the history of the world and the world in conflict and the world in peace and so him and I basically, we don’t have a political relationship, we really talk about the martial arts and the philosophy and people and dilemmas in le, that kind of thing. American podcaster Joe Rogan recently shared an image of a fake CNN report depicting Seagal wearing special forces unorm and holding a gun. The fake news report tried to claim Seagal was among Russian special forces positioned around the outskirts of Kyiv. Gerard Depardieu  French actor Gerard Depardieu has been one of Putinaposs closest celebrity pals - but their friendship could be coming to an end as he has somewhat surprisingly denounced the fractricidal war. The -year-old, who has starred in Cyrano de Bergerac and  Dalmatians, actually received Russian citizenship after turning his back on his homeland.Depardieu annoyed many of his fellow countrymen by running off to Russia, which was apparently to avoid paying large taxes in France after a highly publicised tax row.Putin himself signed the decree granting Russian citizenship to Depardieu, who described Russia as a great democracy, and not a country where the prime minister calls one of its citizens shabby. The actor responded by writing an open letter saying: I love your country, Russia - its people, its history, its writers. I love your culture, your intelligence. Depardieu travelled to Russia in  to be officially given his Russian passport and had an audience with Putin. The pair shook hands and hugged each other at the meeting in Sochi, although the presidentaposs spokesman said he did not hand over the document personally.  The actor was later invited to set up home in the central Russian region of Mordovia, known for its Stalin-era prison camps. Local governor Vladimir Volkov said Depardieu could choose an apartment or a place to build a house, Interfax news agency reported. After arriving in Mordoviaaposs main city of Saransk, the actor showed off his new passport, saying: I am very happy, itaposs very beautul here. Beautul and soulful people live here. In , Depardieu caused outrage in his native France by appearing in a aposnauseousapos advertisement in which he boasted about shooting a deer and being a Russian. Proud to be Russian said the actor, who was then seen kneeling over a dead dear and blowing a kiss. , the online French news outlet, meanwhile called the advertisement vulgar, while GQ magazine said it was a mixture of nauseous wordplay and pathetic production quality. But now the love-in between Putin and Depardieu may be coming to an end as the the actor denounced Russiaaposs war with Ukraine. In a shock move, the film star posted a photo on Instagram with the message: Russia and Ukraine have always been brother countries.Although he did not call out Putin directly and called on both nations to start negotiating for peace. I am against this fratricidal war, he added. I say, Stop the weapons and negotiate.apos However, the Ukrainian people are unlikely to change their opinion on Depardieu because of his past links. Back in , the Ukrainian government included the French actor on a list of cultural figures who were a threat to the countryaposs security. While no specic reason was stated, it is believed the decision is linked to controversial comments he made questioning Ukraineaposs independence. At the Baltic Pearl movie festival in Latvia in , Depardieu said that he loved both Russia and Ukraine, which is part of Russia. title: volodymyr zelensky survives 3 kremlin
story: Volodymyr Zelensky survives  Kremlin assassination plots due to double agentsA group of  mercenaries from the Kremlin-backed Wagner group and Chechen special forces were reportedly sent to Ukraine up to five weeks ago to decapitate the Ukrainian governmentYesterday, president Zelensky  urged Putin to sit down with him and talk in order to bring an end to the now eight day invasion Image: UKRAINE PRESIDENCY AFP via GettyByAbigail OLearyNews Reporter:,  Mar |comments Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelensky survived three assassination attempts in a week after plots were foiled by double agents, according to reports.A group of  mercenaries from the Kremlin-backed Wagner group and Chechen special forces were reportedly sent to Ukraine up to five weeks ago to aposdecapitateapos the Ukrainian government. In the last week alone, it is believed there have been three attempts to take out President Zelensky.Last week, the assassins were said to be awaiting a green light from the Kremlin to move on Mr Zelensky, however the plan was said to be abandoned as they reached the upper echelons of the Ukrainian government. For all the live updates from the Russian invasion follow our liveblogThe assassinations were reportedly foiled when double agents within Russiaaposs Federal Security Service, The Times reported.The underground assassin group are said to have infiltrated Ukraine with a -name aposkill listapos targeting the entire Cabinet - including the mayor of Kyiv Vitali Klitschko and his brother Wladimir.It is widely believed that the group is at the beck and call of Vladimir Putin, although the Kremlin has repeatedly denied this.The force is said to be heavily involved in supplying weapons, experienced operations personnel and military training to pro-Russian militias in eastern Ukraine. The group has previously been deployed by the Kremlin outside of Russia, to carry out black ops operations that Putin wants done while avoiding direct responsibility.  After Moscow invaded last week, Zelensky addressed the nation, claiming that Russian special forces were in the capital searching for him as “target No ”. However when he was offered the chance to flee by America he said: “I need ammunition, not a ride.” Zelensky vowed to stay and fight for his country in the face of Russian aggressions.Yesterday, president Zelensky urged Putin to sit down with him and talk in order to bring an end to the now eight day invasion.In an address to the Russian leader, Zelensky said: Get off our land. You donapost want to leave now  Then sit down with me at the negotiation table. Iaposm available. Sit. Just not  metres away like with Macron or Scholz etc. I am your neighbour. You donapost need to keep me  metres away.  I donapost bite. Iaposm a normal bloke. Sit down with me and talk. What are you afraid of  We arenapost threatening anyone, weaposre not terrorists, we arenapost seizing banks and seizing foreign land.It follows the Ukraine presidentaposs earlier comments, in which he warned Russia would pay for their invasion of the country.He said: We will restore every house, every street, every city and we say to Russia: learn the word of reparations and contributions. You will reimburse us for everything you did against our state, against every Ukrainian in full. title: woman relationship toy plane says
story: Woman in relationship with a toy plane says he’s the best partner she’s ever hadSandra, , from Budapest, Hungary, said she has fallen in love for the first time and found her soulmate after buying the £ toy jet which she calls LuffancsSandra pictured with an inflatable A Austrian Airlines plane Image: Jam PressByOlive Loveridge GreenLaura SharmanNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsA woman has found love for the first time with a toy plane and said it is the best partner she has ever had. Sandra, , sleeps in the same bed as her jet lover which she kisses good morning and goodnight every day.The aviation worker, from Budapest, Hungary, started her whirlwind romance with a toy plane, which she fondly calls Luffancs, in January after buying him online for £. I donapost know why I love him, I just love him, she said.Heaposs beautul and my soulmate. He is the first thing I see in the mornings and the last thing when I go to sleep. I wouldnapost have it any other way. Sandra first became obsessed with planes aged three and dreamed about working with them throughout her teenage years.  In , she managed to land a job in the aviation industry, meaning she could spend the majority of her time surrounded by her favourite things – planes. Her previous partners have not had an issue with her fondness for planes. But after breaking up with her ex last year, Sandra decided to take the plunge and enter into her first relationship with an object.  Since then, the relationship has gone from strength to strength with Sandra claiming she has finally fallen in love for the first time in her le. We cuddle and kiss throughout the night and have sex. I get to do everything with him, she said. The airport worker even claims that Luffancs is the best partner she has ever had.  She said: I have never felt like this with a partner before. For the first time in my le, I am in love. I have always liked planes, more than the average person. Itaposs never been a problem in my other relationships. They havenapost said anything and I never asked. If I go away for the weekend, I make sure I take him with me. Heaposs always there for me.  Despite working in an airport five days a week with temptation around every corner, Sandra said she would never dream of cheating on her new love with another aircraft. She added: I have something special and I am not prepared to ruin it. My big love is LX-UCV at the airport but work is work, I just do everything at home.The most I do with other planes at work is just touch and blow a kiss. Iaposm not too sureI will go back to a human relationship. Planes are more reliable as partners. I know I can always speak to him. I like how planes represent endless opportunities. To me, that is something positive and something I want to have in my le.  Object sexuality or objectophilia is a form of sexual or romantic attraction focused on particular inanimate objects. title: woman scoops 26m lottery win
story: Woman scoops £.m lottery win after newsagent who misheard her made a mistakeThe woman was gobsmacked when she checked her lottery ticket and said she couldnt believe her luck. She paid for three tickets rather than her usual two and scooped the jackpotThe woman scooped millions Image: Bloomberg via Getty ImagesByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA woman has won a staggering £.million on the lottery after a newsagent misheard her when she was buying her tickets.The winner, from South Australia, claimed the top prize of £.mon the countryaposs Set for Le lotto which will see her paid in instalments of , - about £,. The woman from Port Adelaide, who has not been named, told reporters that she normally only buys two tickets, but was given and paid for an extra one when the store worker misheard her.She said: I usually buy a standard two-game entry, but when I purchased this ticket, the guy didn’t hear me correctly, and he gave me three games instead. “The third game is the one that won this prize for me, so it feels like it was meant to be! It wouldn’t have happened otherwise.  When the woman checked her lottery ticket she said she couldnapost believe her luck, saying that she was totally gobsmacked. She said: “It was early in the morning when I checked this ticket, so it was very dark still.I’d made my coffee, gone outside to sit on the veranda and listen to the birds, and then I checked my ticket, she said. “Because it was so dark, I wasn’t sureI saw things wrong when I checked the ticket.I probably checked it  times before I started to believe it was true. It was spooky! The woman purchased her ticket at Plympton Newsagency and she plans on giving back to the staff there. Read more The lottery winner added: I’m going to go down to the newsagency and give the staff something to say thanks for helping me win ision one. “I’m going to use this prize to renovate my house completely. It’ll feel like a new home when It’s done! I’d love to get an interior designer in to make it special. “Then I’d like to use the rest to help people – my family, friends and charities that mean something to me.I believe you need to give back, so that’s at the top of the list. title: remembering-comedian-tommy-morgan-king-glasgow-patter
story: Much-admired and much loved Glasgow comedian Tommy Morgan was born in Bridgeton in , the son of a trades union activist. He became a huge music hall star in the s, s and s, starring in numerous pantos and shows across Scotland. Glasgow audiences loved his cheeky face and gallus chat and he was often seen on stage at the likes of the Pavilion and the pole.
